subject: p10933609
History: DVT presenting with lower right chest pain.
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. There are low lung volumes. Right upper lobe scarring/chronic fibrosis in the right greater than left upper lobes are again seen. New since the prior study, there is left mid lung streaky opacity and to a lesser extent in the left lower lobe. No pleural effusion is seen. The cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are stable.
Impression: Stable right greater than left upper lobe fibrotic changes. New opacity in the left mid-to-lower lung raises concern for infectious process versus possibly asymmetric edema. Recommend followup to resolution.
